messages.title: ONLY A MAJORITY GOVERNMENT CAN GET ON WITH THE COUNTRY’S PRIORITIES
messages.content: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE TOWN CENTRE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: A hard line on anti-social behaviour so people feel safe on our streets; a better balanced town centre where people want to come for work and leisure, to live and shop.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: MORE SUPPORT FOR OUR LOCAL NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Standing up for Stoke Mandeville & Wycombe hospitals; campaigning for more GPs so patients can be seen sooner in their local surgeries.
Saying no to HS2 so we can protect our countryside; saying yes to better roads, modern transport connections and fast broadband for all.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Polls teeter between hung parliament and slim Tory majority. A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence vote.

issues.education: English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost.
issues.health: MORE SUPPORT FOR OUR LOCAL NHS - Standing up for Stoke Mandeville & Wycombe hospitals; campaigning for more GPs so patients can be seen sooner in their local surgeries.

endorsements.endorsement: Appears in photo with Boris Johnson

quotes.text: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. LET’S GET ON WITH OUR PRIORITIES.

images.caption: Rob Butler with residents and local businesses
